title: Married At First Sight's Jules Robinson reveals she's gained weight despite 'working really hard'
text:
She's the Married At First Sight star who has vowed to lose 10kg before marrying her TV 'husband' Cameron Merchant.

But on Thursday, Jules Robinson, who was announced as an ambassador for Weight Watchers last month, revealed she didn't reach her goal despite training 'really hard.'

Taking to Instagram, the 37-year-old wrote in candid post: 'This week I didn’t lose any weight I actually gained.'

'It’s not always about the number': Married At First Sight's Jules Robinson (pictured) revealed that she's gained weight despite 'working really hard'

'Of course I felt a little meh once I got off the scales but what matters is that I worked really hard this week and I made steps to being a healthier me. I ran! I don’t run and I did!,' she added.

She continued: 'I am 100 per cent that woman that once a month feels like I go up a dress size, this is life and what happened today was real life.'

Jules, who has lost 3kg since joining WW, said it is 'okay to not hit those goals' and that she will continue to share her experience.

'It’s not always about the number': Jules, who was announced as an ambassador for Weight Watchers last month, took to Instagram to share an update with her followers

'My role as a ambassador I feel is to share my story and hopefully inspire you to make changes for a healthier life and be the best version of your self too,' she wrote.

'It’s not always about the number it’s also a feeling too,' she ended.

Meanwhile, last month Jules revealed that she plans to look her 'healthiest' ahead of her wedding to Cam after putting on 10 kilograms since filming for MAFS ended in September last year.

Wedding bells: Jules (right) has vowed to lose weight before marrying her TV husband Cameron Merchant (left)

Speaking to The Sunday Telegraph, the 37-year-old said: 'I want to look fabulous on my wedding day and I want to start a family soon, so I want my body to be in its best form to make a baby and to bounce back from that as well.'

Jules admitted that she has always been a curvy woman but the weight 'just crept on'.

'I hold the weight pretty well but the scales don’t lie. I don’t know how it happened,' she said.
description: Jules Robinson was announced as an ambassador for Weight Watchers last month.
authors: Mary Mrad For Daily Mail Australia
